intro: Reichardia picroides var. intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow, showy flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. It has palmate leaves with three to five lobes and produces small, hairy fruits. Reichardia picroides var. intermedia is often considered a weed in agricultural settings due to its rapid growth and ability to spread easily.
